org.jsapar.convert

Class ConvertTask

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.jsapar.convert.ConvertTask
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    ConcurrentConvertTask

    public class ConvertTask
extends Object
    Reads from supplied parseTask and outputs each line to the composer. By adding a LineManipulator you are able to make modifications of each line before it is written to the output. The method LineManipulator.manipulate(Line) of all added LineManipulators are called for each line that is parsed successfully.

    For each line, the line type of the parsed line is considered when choosing the line type of the output schema line. This means that lines with a type that does not exist in the output schema will be discarded in the output.

    If your want lines to be discarded from the output depending of their contents, add a LineManipulator that returns false for the lines that should not be composed.

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Class and Description
      protected class  ConvertTask.LineForwardListener
      Internal class for handling output of one line at a time while receiving parsing events.

      • setErrorEventListener

        public void setErrorEventListener(ErrorEventListener errorListener)
        Sets new error listener to both the parse task and the composer. Can be called after creation but before calling execute().
        Parameters:
        errorListener - The new error event listener to use for both parsing and composing.

      • addLineManipulator

        public void addLineManipulator(LineManipulator manipulator)
        Adds LineManipulator to this converter. All present line manipulators are executed for each line.
        Parameters:
        manipulator - The line manipulator to add.
